title: Crispy Chinese Noodles Recipe
description: These crispy noodles are easy to make at home with just two ingredients and taste just like the ones you munch on at your favorite Chinese restaurant.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Pasta and Noodles Noodle Recipes Crispy Chinese Noodles 4.8 (11) 10 Reviews 6 Photos Serve these crispy noodles with Chinese mustard and duck sauce as an appetizer, or use them as a garnish for soups. They're just like the ones you get at a Chinese restaurant. I love to sprinkle them over my egg-drop soup. Submitted by OdaMae Updated on August 18, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 6 6 6 6 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 15 mins Total Time: 20 mins Servings: 8 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 1 (10 ounce) package egg roll wrappers 2 cups vegetable oil, or as needed Directions Gather the ingredients. ALLRECIPES / DIANA CHISTRUGA Cut egg roll wrappers into 1-inch strips. ALLRECIPES / DIANA CHISTRUGA Heat a wok over medium heat until very hot. Pour oil into the hot wok and heat until shimmering. To test the heat, lower the tip of a wooden chopstick into the oil; if it bubbles vigorously, the oil is ready. ALLRECIPES / DIANA CHISTRUGA Gently place 2 to 3 strips into hot oil; cook until beginning to brown on one side, 30 seconds to 1 minute. Gently flip and cook until crisp and golden brown all over, 30 seconds to 1 minute more. ALLRECIPES / DIANA CHISTRUGA Use a slotted spoon to transfer fried strips to a paper towel-lined plate. Repeat to fry remaining strips. ALLRECIPES / DIANA CHISTRUGA From the Editor We have determined the nutritional value of oil for frying based on a retention value of 10% after cooking. Amount will vary depending on cooking time and temperature, ingredient density, and specific type of oil used. I Made It Print 32 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 151 Calories 6g Fat 20g Carbs 3g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 8 Calories 151 % Daily Value * Total Fat 6g 8% Saturated Fat 1g 4% Cholesterol 3mg 1% Sodium 200mg 9% Total Carbohydrate 20g 7% Dietary Fiber 1g 2% Protein 3g 7% Calcium 16mg 1% Iron 1mg 7% Potassium 29mg 1% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Crispy Chinese Noodles 01 of 06 Photo by  ALLRECIPES / DIANA CHISTRUGA 02 of 06 Photo by  TwistyFlan1574 02/24/2024 Easy to follow Crowd-pleaser These crispy noodles are super crunchy—almost impossible to resist! From just one package of wrappers, you'll have a generous bowl of incredibly crunchy snacks. 03 of 06 Photo by  Vez Roth 06/06/2018 04 of 06 Photo by  Joy Chism 02/11/2018 05 of 06 Photo by  OdaMae 06/03/2012 Exactly like the crispy noodles you get at the restaurants! You must be careful not to cook them too long, these noodles brown very fast and must be watched continuously. The perfect addition to soups or salads! 06 of 06 Photo by  OdaMae 06/03/2012 Exactly like the crispy noodles you get at the restaurants! You must be careful not to cook them too long, these noodles brown very fast and must be watched continuously. The perfect addition to soups or salads! 1 You’ll Also Love Asian Ground Beef Noodle Bowls 37 Ratings Five-Ingredient Red Curry Chicken 29 Ratings Easy Ramen Peanut Pasta 8 Ratings Chocolate Spiders 83 Ratings Singapore Noodle Curry Shrimp 100 Ratings Chow Mein with Chicken and Vegetables 146 Ratings Stir-Fried Shanghai Noodles 4 Ratings Mushroom, Kale, and Bok Choy Ramen 1 Rating Asian Chicken Salad 630 Ratings Easy Shrimp Lo Mein 28 Ratings Hawaiian Beef Teriyaki Stir-Fry Bowl 1 Rating Drunken Noodles 8 Ratings Thai-Style Pork Noodle Bowl 5 Ratings Ramen Bowl 5 Ratings Spicy Beef and Broccoli Chow Mein 43 Ratings Chinese Chicken Salad 55 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
